name: Pucllana Site Museum
address: Ca. Gral. Borgoño cdra. 8, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: SPICY
reviews.text:
Huaca Pucllana: 4000-year-old pyramid, check. Boring guide who puts you to sleep, check. If you're gonna make me walk on ancient genius pyramid, at least make the tour entertaining. Suggestion: skip the guide and hit up the Larco Museum first. Learn more over there Trust me, you'll be way more impressed when you finally get to the real education. And honestly, just read the Wikipedia page, you'll learn more.
Need tour guide and takes about one hour.

reviews.author: Kristian Peter
reviews.text:
2000+ years of history packed into the center of Miraflores. A must see when visiting Lima to acquire some of the history and respect for previous civilization. The adobe architecture is incredible as millions of bricks were assembled into the pyramid that took hundreds of years to assemble. Get to see some of the agriculture and animals of Peru - guinea pigs and alpacas.

The museum offers some insight, but the real value is the guided tours that leave every 30 minutes and are offered in both English and Spanish. Cost of entry is S/ 15, about $4 (includes the tour)

reviews.author: Andrea Stella
reviews.text: This is such a fun treasure in the city! It's a quick 45-60 min tour talking about the Lima culture that predates the Inca civilization. It's not an intense hike, but closed toed shoes and pants are a good idea just because of the dust. We went on an overcast day and it was perfect, I can see it getting super hot on a sunny day, there is no shade.

reviews.author: Rebecca Ortiz
reviews.text:
We visited in the morning and it was the perfect time to go. It’s so cool to see this massive ancient site right in the middle of modern Lima and it was literally behind our hotel.

They offer tours in both English and Spanish, and it’s included in the ticket price. Yours are required to visit. Our guide did a great job explaining the history and how the structure was used by the Lima culture over 1,500 years ago. The pyramid made of adobe bricks is super impressive up close!

reviews.author: Geoffrey Bishop
reviews.text: Huaca Pucllana is a fascinating archaeological site right in the heart of Lima. The guided tour brings the history of this ancient adobe pyramid to life, explaining its importance to the Lima culture long before the Incas. It’s incredible to see such a well-preserved piece of history surrounded by the modern city. A positive and worthwhile experience for anyone interested in Peru’s rich past. You have to have a guide with you to enter. This is part of the admission fee.

name: Malecón de Miraflores
address: Mal. de la Reserva 275, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Sunilkumar Ambalge
reviews.text: The Malecón in Miraflores is one of the most beautiful spots to experience in Lima, especially in the morning. Walking along the cliffs with the Pacific Ocean stretching endlessly in front of you is truly breathtaking. The fresh morning breeze, the sound of the waves crashing against the rocks, and the calm atmosphere make it a perfect place to start the day. The parks along the Malecón are well-maintained with colorful flowers, palm trees, and jogging or cycling tracks where you can see locals staying active. In the early hours, it feels peaceful and less crowded, giving you uninterrupted views of the ocean and the sunrise glow reflecting over the water. The scenic beauty, combined with the clean pathways and green spaces, makes the Malecón a must-visit not just for tourists but also for anyone who loves nature and tranquility.

reviews.author: Lasitha Leelasena
reviews.text: Nice place for a leisure walk.  Beautiful sunset

reviews.author: Anthony R.
reviews.text: A beautiful walk with perfectly landscaped surroundings and stunning ocean views.  An old lighthouse, monuments, artwork, a pagoda on a cliff.  Great exercise with an ocean breeze!  Not to be missed.

reviews.author: Kimberly Clemens
reviews.text: Such a beautiful place for a walk to catch the sunset. Lots of areas to sit and green space for the dogs and kids to play or to picnic.

reviews.author: Eloïse Lafleche
reviews.text: A nice walk to take in the beautiful coastal views of Lima

reviews.author: Keith Moore
reviews.text: This is a nice little park along the walkway linking many other parks.  It is a good place to sit down and have a rest.  There is a small cafe nearby to grab a coffee or soft drink.

reviews.author: Sanjeeta Pai
reviews.text: Lovely park with that big statue and amazing views of the ocean. The tile work is adorable too. The park area looks clean  and safe. We took a lot of pictures here and sat down and enjoyed the breeze. There were a lot of people at the time we went.

reviews.author: Giulia Scapin
reviews.text: Nothing special. Some writings on the walls are vulgar, which I did not find romantic or poetic. It's an area full of people who want to sell you souvenirs, which gets a bit annoying given the concentration of sellers.

reviews.author: Alvaro Cepeda
reviews.text: Love park is great place to take a break and go for a walk to get good energy and positive vibe!!

reviews.author: Cesar Chica
reviews.text: I love this park. First time in Lima June 2025, sunny day, amazing sunset, nice people good vibes.

name: Maria Reiche Park
address: VXM2+MHC, Mal. de la Marina, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Me Lizzy
reviews.text: Didn't get to see the lights the last time since it was too early, but I was able to enjoy it today.

reviews.author: Dean J
reviews.text:
I decided to take a leisurely walk all the water and this was a great way to spend it. There is a quite lengthy path from Barranco down to Miraflores. It appears to be a series of parks where you’ll see a mix of things as you progress through the various sections.

Some kids will be playing sports, little family picnics, people just sunbathing/reading. In some areas, you’ll see some snacks for sale or companies selling parasailing adventures.

reviews.author: Andres Vargas Higuera
reviews.text: The sunsets here are truly spectacular, offering breathtaking views year-round, whether it's the warm glow of summer or the crisp chill of winter

reviews.author: Pavan Singh
reviews.text: A beautiful lush green park near the beach. Lots of events are organized here, I attended world yoga day event there organized by municipalidad de Miraflores. A perfect place for doing yoga and other exercises. This park allows pets also. Must visit.

reviews.author: Eugene Rhee
reviews.text: Beautiful park that even some Lima natives don’t even know about! Nazca line on a budget! I strongly suggest walking along the entire waterfront along the many parks (up on the cliffs, not the beach which is a separate walk).

name: John F. Kennedy park
address: Av. Oscar R. Benavides, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Sunilkumar Ambalge
reviews.text: Beautiful and lively park in the heart of Miraflores. The place is very well maintained, clean, and always full of energy. The unique highlight is the large number of friendly cats roaming around, which makes the park quite special. In the evenings, you can enjoy street performances, small fairs, and local food stalls. It’s surrounded by restaurants, cafes, and shops, so it’s a perfect spot to relax or take a break while exploring the city. A must-visit when in Lima, especially if you love cats and vibrant local culture.

reviews.author: SPICY
reviews.text: I'm utterly smitten! This cat park is an absolute haven! The moment I stepped in, I was surrounded by bundles of fur and affection. Each little ball of fluff had its own unique personality, and I couldn't get enough of their adorable snuggles and purrs. I'm already planning my next visit - 10/10 would recommend to all cat lovers out there! If you're a cat person like me, you'll fall head over heels for this place!

reviews.author: Truthsayer
reviews.text: The park was very active/ crowded as it was a Sunday. We loved seeing the colorful art being sold by artists. The cat stalls, karaoke being sung by Asian artists, the many interesting stalls. The place has a vibrant, joyful atmosphere.

reviews.author: NZ Wild Rose
reviews.text:
Absolutely one of the highlights of Lima, a park full of cats!
With little cat hotels around the park to house them, lovely volunteers who show up to feed the cats daily, and some lovely snuggles if you just quietly sit on the grass and wait. There’s always a lap cat waiting for a cuddle.

reviews.author: Ran Bluebells
reviews.text: There are a lot of cats in this park, most of them strays. People have built small houses for them to live in. But I wonder what these cats are like during the winter or rainy season when it rains heavily. Many tourists come to take pictures with the cats. I find them cute but also feel sorry for them.

reviews.author: Keith Moore
reviews.text: This is a nice place to walk and view the coastline and paragliders in good weather.  There are numerous parks along this stretch, with tennis and pickleball courts available.  The lighthouse itself is historical and interesting.

reviews.author: Pritam Mukherjee
reviews.text: Nice walk along the sea beach. Great view If the weather is sunny.

reviews.author: Frank Linskens
reviews.text: Beautiful areas to walk down the coast line of Lima.

reviews.author: Paola Manditch
reviews.text: We visited El Faro (the marine lighthouse) during our recent trip to Peru. It’s located in Miraflores, just two blocks from where I went to school! The area is beautiful, with manicured landscaping and amazing ocean views. Such a nice spot to take a walk, relax, or snap a great picture like this one! Definitely recommend stopping by if you’re in the area.

reviews.author: Geoffrey Bishop
reviews.text: Beautiful spot to watch the surf and paragliders.

name: Alfredo Salazar Park
address: Ubicado al final de la Av. Larco, en la intersección del Malecón de la Reserva y de la Av., VX99+8RH, Av. Armendáriz, Miraflores 15074, Peru

reviews.author: Lucy
reviews.text: It has a small playground area, perfect for the little ones to have some fun. Ocean views are amazing.

reviews.author: A V (globetrotter)
reviews.text:
The park is a historical landmark named after Alfredo Salazar Southwell, a young aviator of the Peruvian Air Force hailed as a national hero 🇵🇪🇵🇪🇵🇪🇵🇪🇵🇪

*** The field is the site of his plane crash in 1937. While preparing for the national celebration of José Chavez, the plane he piloted had mechanical problems that he ordered his co-pilot to parachute to safety. He flew the troubled plane out of the populated area of Lima, crashing into then an open field on the cliffs of Miraflores Borough, saving hundreds of lives at the expense of his own!

The park was built by Lima City in 1953 to honor Salazar Southwell’s ultimate sacrifice.

Today, the park is a vibrant center of human activity of modern Lima. It is Central Miraflores itself, the focal point of the Malecón with a lovely view of the cliffs and the ocean. The park is the home of the Larcomar commercial and entertainment complex.

reviews.author: Manny Alonzo
reviews.text: Beautiful park-in miraflores Peru at the edge of a Cliff overlooking the ocean.  There is a Mall located in the park with a lot of restaurants and shops. Along the walking trail of the park are small trucks and shops selling snacks. Very peaceful and serene place to visit .

reviews.author: Carlos E Carrillo
reviews.text: Absolutely stunning location with a beautiful view! Perfect spot to unwind and relax while enjoying the mesmerizing parachutes overhead. Conveniently close to the mall, and the sea view is simply breathtaking. Highly recommended for a tranquil escape!

reviews.author: K H
reviews.text: Beautiful clean park in the edge of a Clift overlooking the ocean. Surprisingly quiet and serene. Mall located underneath and snacks sold in small carts.

reviews.author: Frank Linskens
reviews.text: Beautiful views but parc is under construction but seems almost finished.

reviews.author: Jeremy Miller
reviews.text: Large park with multiple workout stations and many benches. Relax and workout, your choice. Don’t like either? Look out to the beautiful Atlantic Ocean and coast of Lima. Great views.

reviews.author: gordon heitshu
reviews.text: Enjoyed a nice walk along the coast. No worries about safety at all.

reviews.author: Kelvin So
reviews.text:
Cool park, clean, safe. Obviously there's a few people trying to sell you stuff but they are not pushy or intrusive.
Definitely check this place out.
Has good views of the water as well chairs that has Gaudi vibes.

reviews.author: Steven Lau
reviews.text: Great place to feel the blowing sea wind, watching the beautiful scene, the parasail flying with the birds, to feel the sea water flushing the bank. You must be here waiting to see the sunset at about 18:00 which is real beautiful.
